content.headline: Preparing Your Body for Labor Through Exercise
content.intro: Regular exercise during pregnancy can significantly impact your childbirth experience by strengthening the muscles needed for labor and improving your overall stamina. Proper physical preparation helps build endurance, manage pain, and promote faster recovery postpartum.

sections.title: Benefits of Exercise for Childbirth
sections.content: Staying active during pregnancy provides numerous advantages for labor and delivery:
points: Strengthens uterine and abdominal muscles for more efficient contractions
Improves cardiovascular endurance for handling labor's physical demands
Enhances flexibility in hips and pelvis for better positioning during birth
Reduces risk of gestational diabetes and pregnancy-induced hypertension
Helps maintain healthy weight gain, reducing delivery complications
Promotes better sleep and stress management throughout pregnancy

sections.title: Labor-Specific Exercises
sections.content: Focus on these exercises to prepare for childbirth:
points: Squats: Strengthen thighs and open pelvis for delivery
Kegels: Improve pelvic floor control for pushing stage
Pelvic tilts: Relieve back pain and optimize baby positioning
Walking: Build endurance and encourage baby engagement
Prenatal yoga: Increase flexibility and breathing control

sections.title: Exercise Safety Guidelines
points: Consult your healthcare provider before starting any exercise program
Stop immediately if you experience pain, dizziness, or bleeding
Avoid exercises lying flat on your back after first trimester
Stay hydrated and avoid overheating during workouts
Listen to your body - modify intensity as pregnancy progresses
Focus on consistency rather than intensity throughout pregnancy
